1.title: Meet the Roommates
1.plot: Terry Goldman introduces himself and the roommates.

2.title: Next Verse Same as the First
2.plot: After a few weeks, we see how the roommates are coping with one another. Daisy is enforcing her new chore chart, Celeste comes home with a new friend, and the rest of the household has to suffer through it.

3.title: Louis Card: The Boring Tour Guide
3.plot: Louis takes the camera crew to work with him as he struggles to get a tour guide together. Bert heckles him the entire time.

4.title: Classic Horror Movie Night
4.plot: It's Celeste's turn to choose the movie for Movie Night. This time, they're watching the horrible cult classic movie, "Killmore Villas". Daisy has never seen a horror film and Bert is suspicious if it'll be any good.

5.title: Killmore Villas
5.plot: Kelsey, Amanda, and Marina are all looking for a new apartment. With Alberto as their tour-guide, we learn about the building's tragic past and the even more sinister serial killer that lives within its walls.

6.title: Love Is All You Need... Right?
6.plot: Everyone is hit by the love bug. Celeste has a crush on a hipster, Terry begins to show feelings for Celeste, Bert hooks up with the hot librarian, Felicity, and Louis and Daisy get into an argument about marriage.

7.title: 'Love' Is Not the 4-Letter Word of Choice
7.plot: After being rejected by her hipster crush, Celeste has a mental breakdown. Bert somehow messed up the date with Felicity, but hopes to salvage it. Daisy and Louis have a heart-to-heart.

8.title: Won't You Be My Neighbor?
8.plot: The roommates throw a party for Bronco, the next door neighbor. Things get pretty bad.

9.title: The Fit Hits the Shan
9.plot: Tensions are high and Louis gets overly outraged by the amount of lying going on in the household and leaves.

10.title: To the Batcave!
10.plot: After leaving the household, Terry follows an agitated Louis to his favorite bar and gets him drunk. We then learn that Louis has his own private getaway and he takes us there.

11.title: le Denouement
11.plot: After Louis angrily kicks Terry out of the Batcave, Terry is forced to go back to the roommates and explain what happened. This is then interrupted by a belligerent Louis barging in and calling out everyone in the house on their faults.

12.title: Aussie Aussie Oxen-Free
12.plot: Louis wants to make up for the Drunk Louis fiasco by taking everyone on a trip to Australia. Bert is deathly afraid of kangaroos. In this season finale, we aren't sure whether or not anyone is coming back from this trip.

imdb.title: The Roommates
synopsis: An alleged Oscar-nominated documentary filmmaker, Terry Goldman (Michael Hunter), has a dream of making the world's most entertaining documentary movie the world has ever seen. With inspiration from shows like "Big Brother" and "The Amazing Race", he decides to put together the world's most interesting people under one house and film them reacting off of one another. Unfortunately, after his team is rounded up, he finds out that they're not all that talkative, let alone socially awkward. We follow the "eventful" lives of an ex-NFL linebacker with narcolepsy named Bert Williams (Ernest Briggs IV), a hand model named Vladimir Illic (Filip Milenkovic), a prodigy trapeze artist now turned kindergarden teacher named Daisy Baxter (Tessa Flores), a hipster photographer named Celeste Graham (Mikaela Euro), and a socially awkward former body-builder fresh out of a monk monastery, Louis Card (Michael Barlow). When you include a deaf cat, nosey neighbors, Hollywood Boulevard, Jason Vorheez, and killer kangaroos to the mix, Terry Goldman finds himself with one helluva show.In the end of this episodic journey, the ensemble cast of distinct characters end up learning how to deal with the hardships of life and eventually find the heart of what really matters most: family. Joining them are constantly working upcoming actors like Austin Rising as Bronco Abernathy (the next-door neighbor), Ross Le as the handsome hipster, Carolyn Feres as Felicity Jones (the sexy librarian), and Michael Torres as Jason.
